## Gene Details:

- **Gene Symbol:** <u>AAE7, ACN1, BZU1</u>
- **Gene Name:** acyl-activating enzyme 7, ACETATE NON-UTILIZING 1
- **Description:**   acyl-activating enzyme 7;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** locus:2086122
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [CS65814]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;No visible phenotype.
   - [CS65815]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;No visible phenotype.
   - [WiscDsLoxHs036_06B]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Inhibition of shoot and root growth when grown on 1 mM acetate.
   - [acn1-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Exhibited the highest level of resistance to fluoroacetate (FAc). Its germination and growth was unaffected by the toxin in the presence of exogenous sucrose. In the presence of FAc with no sucrose, post-germinative growth may have been slightly affected. When germinated and grown on sodium acetate, the mutant exhibited bleaching at concentrations which had little effect on the wild type.
   - [acn1-2]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Growth is more severely affected by 3.5 mM acetate than wt plants.  Under these conditions, mutant plant growth decreased 50-60% compared to no treatment while wt plant growth decreased 30-40%.  Disrupted in thier ability to sense acetate.
   - [acn1-3]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Disrupted in the ability to sense acetate.
   - [acs-1 acn1-5]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Serrated leaf margins, short petioles, increased number of rosette leaves, delayed bolting, increased axillary branching, dwarf, delayed senescence, abnormal flower development.
## Function-related keywords:
   - [vascular leaf](/tags/vascular-leaf/)
